SENT.plain: Four Chinese patients with extensive smooth muscle tumors of the inferior vena cava (IVC) and right heart are described
Two patients had primary IVC leiomyosarcomas and one had both IVC and cardiac metastases from uterine leiomyosarcoma
The remaining patient had extra-uterine intravenous leiomyomatosis, with extensive tumor calcification
Clinical presentation was variable, consisting of the Budd-Chiari syndrome, a new heart murmur, and signs of cerebral embolism
All the lesions were defined radiologically prior to surgical resection of cardiac tumors
